conclusion: To determine when particles A and B are the farthest apart, analyze positions as functions of time.
Velocity-time graph shows velocity functions for particles A and B.

Identify velocity functions for particle A: \( v_A(t) = 2v_0 t \) for \( t = 0 \) to \( t = t_0 \), \( v_A(t) = 4v_0 t_0 - 2v_0 t \) for \( t = t_0 \) to \( t = 3t_0 \), \( v_A(t) = 8v_0 t_0 - 2v_0 t \) for \( t = 3t_0 \) to \( t = 6t_0 \).
Identify velocity functions for particle B: \( v_B(t) = \frac{v_0}{5} t \) for \( t = 0 \) to \( t = 5t_0 \), \( v_B(t) = v_0 \) for \( t = 5t_0 \) to \( t = 6t_0 \).
Integrate velocity function for particle A from \( t = 0 \) to \( t = t_0 \) to find position: \( s_A(t) = v_0 t^2 \).
Integrate velocity function for particle A from \( t = t_0 \) to \( t = 3t_0 \) to find position: \( s_A(t) = v_0 t_0^2 + 6v_0 t_0 t - v_0 t^2 \).
Integrate velocity function for particle A from \( t = 3t_0 \) to \( t = 6t_0 \) to find position: \( s_A(t) = v_0 9t_0^2 + 14v_0 t_0 t - v_0 t^2 + 10v_0 t_0^2 \).
Integrate velocity function for particle B from \( t = 0 \) to \( t = 5t_0 \) to find position: \( s_B(t) = \frac{v_0}{10} t^2 \).
Integrate velocity function for particle B from \( t = 5t_0 \) to \( t = 6t_0 \) to find position: \( s_B(t) = \frac{5v_0 t_0^2}{2} + v_0 t - 5v_0 t_0 \).
Determine time when distance between A and B is maximized by analyzing \( |s_A(t) - s_B(t)| \).
